snippet: Dan Ariely, a psychology and behavioral economics professor at Duke, hopes his new card game, which offers miniature social-science experiments, will spur conversation about decision making.
abstract: Duke University psychology and behavioral economics Prof Dan Ariely has created Irrational Game, card game that allows players to discover degree to which they make irrational decisions in spending money; Ariely hopes to spur discussion about way people think about money and wealth.
lead_paragraph: Dan Ariely, a psychology and behavioral economics professor at Duke, hopes his new card game, which offers miniature social-science experiments, will spur conversation about decision making.

headline.main: Irrational Game Aims to Steer Consumers Toward Rational Choices
